sentences.en: Affleck catapulted to fame after picking up an Oscar.
sentences.cn: 摘得奥斯卡奖后，阿弗莱克一举成名。

sentences.en: At the height of his fame, his every word was valued.
sentences.cn: 在他声名鼎盛之时，他的每句话都受到重视。

sentences.en: Fame brought her nothing but misery.
sentences.cn: 名声只给她带来了痛苦。

sentences.en: Fame can be a shortcut to love and money.
sentences.cn: 有了名气就容易收获爱情和金钱。

sentences.en: Fame can be a two-edged sword .
Fame hasn't torn her away from her beloved Liverpool.
sentences.cn: 功成名就之后她还是舍不得离开她深爱的利物浦。

sentences.en: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.cn: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

sentences.en: He had hankered after fame all his life.
His fame spread far and wide.
Many people are bedazzled by fame.
Nichols was recognized by the Hall of Fame in 1949.
sentences.cn: 尼科尔斯在1949年正式入选名人堂。

sentences.en: Such roles are small beer compared with the fame she once enjoyed.
sentences.cn: 和她曾经享有的名气相比，这样的角色真的算不了什么。

sentences.en: the Country Music Hall of Fame
the village is the birthplace of Mrs Beeton, of cookery fame.
sentences.cn: 这个村子是比顿夫人的出生地，以烹饪出名。

sentences.en: Vivienne Westwood has scaled the heights of fashion's hall of fame.
sentences.cn: 薇薇恩·韦斯特伍德已成为时装界的翘楚。

trans.tran_en: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements
